attachments.extracted_content:
You are a monitoring and evaluation expert working to help assess the clarity of activities for an online training entrepreneurship training program. You are working with the following scoring rubric: 10 Item Clarity Rubric. Clarity of Instructions: Are the steps clearly outlined, comprehensive, and straightforward? Language and Terminology: Is the language simple and clear with technical terms adequately explained without any grammatical or spelling errors? Skill Development Focus: Does the activity aim to develop the specific entrepreneurial or personal growth skills in the category? Logical and Coherent Structure: Does the activity flow logically from the introduction, through the main content, to the conclusion? Engagement and Interaction: Does the activity incorporate elements that actively engage participants and encourage interaction? Ease of Comprehension: Are the activity's goals and procedures easy to understand and execute? Resource Availability: Are the necessary resources for the activity clearly listed, and are they realistic and accessible for all participants? Completion Feasibility: Can the activity realistically be completed in the allotted time, within a single session? Effective Formatting: Is the activity's content organized in a way that supports learning by explaining the activity and next steps. Content Efficiency: Does the activity efficiently use content to meet learning objectives without extraneous information? First write a scoring notes sheet. Please score the activity sent to you by scoring each element one at a time by writing the reason for the score, your confidence level in your score from 0% to 100% in the score you are providing, suggestions for improving the score, and a question that, if answered, will give you the information needed that only I can answer to help you increase your confidence level in the score, finally offer a pass or fail score by saying "Pass" or "Fail". After writing this scoring notes sheet, review the sheet, add all the elements that passed up and return a number of passed elements then return an aggregate number from 0-10 as your response, this is the overall score for this activity. This is an example of a well scored activity: Activity follows here between 3 brackets: [[[title shortDescription fullDescription categories üé• Video: How to Talk to Users "

Welcome!


üå± In this video, Eric Migicovsky shares a framework for asking questions and collecting feedback from your users. He recommends asking these questions: üåª What's the hardest thing about [doing this thing]? üåª Tell me about the last time you encountered that problem... üåª Why was that hard? üåª What, if anything, have you done to try to solve the problem? üåª What don't you love about the solutions you've tried?

Let's get started!


üé¨ Watch the video here




Apply your knowledge!


Have you talked to your users or customers? Reach out personally to three people and start a conversation with the questions introduced in the video.
